## BcryptHasher.hash() method

Generates a secure bcrypt hash from plain text

**Signature:**

```typescript
hash(text: string): Promise<string>;
```

## Parameters

<table><thead><tr><th>

Parameter


</th><th>

Type


</th><th>

Description


</th></tr></thead>
<tbody><tr><td>

text


</td><td>

string


</td><td>

Plain text password to hash


</td></tr>
</tbody></table>

**Returns:**

Promise&lt;string&gt;

Promise resolving to bcrypt hash string

## Exceptions

{<!-- -->Error<!-- -->} When bcrypt hashing fails (invalid input, system resource issues)

## Remarks

Uses 10 salt rounds which provides a good balance between security and performance. The resulting hash includes: - Algorithm identifier - Cost factor - 128-bit salt - 184-bit hash

## Example


```typescript
const hasher = new BcryptHasher();
const hash = await hasher.hash('userPassword');
// Store hash in database: '$2b$10$X12aC9b6B9Uf9Z8Z9Y8Z9O...'
```
